@alexander_poplawski 

In the Parameters section, you mentioned the protocol as gRPC, but the port is set to 4318.
This is incorrect because:

  • gRPC uses port 4317

  • HTTP uses port 4318

So, please update the documentation to reflect the correct port for the selected protocol.

Please confirm which protocol should be used:

gRPC (recommended)

  • Uses port 4317

  • Best performance

  • Default for OpenTelemetry Java agent

OR

HTTP

  • Uses port 4318

  • Use only if your environment requires HTTP

When to choose which protocol?

Protocol Port Use When

Please confirm which protocol is required for the SAP NW Java application, and update the documentation accordingly.

entry.title: Re: How to export a photo column (data type image) in a t...
entry.content:
See xp_write_file  or  WRITE_CLIENT_FILE system procedures.  The xp_write_file is relative to the server. If you want the files written to a client, use WRITE_CLIENT_FILE.  Here are examples use the demo datbase Products table.

-- save relative to the server
select xp_write_file( 'C:\\temp\\server\\' || ID || '.jpg', photo) from GROUPO.Products;

-- save relative to the client
set option allow_write_client_file = 'On';
select WRITE_CLIENT_FILE( 'C:\\\temp\\client\\' || ID || '.jpg', photo) from GROUPO.Products;
set option allow_write_client_file = 'Off';

 If you have more that one column that you want process, simply repeat the xp_write_file or WRITE_CLIENT_FILE for each of the columns.  For example, the following saves imageCol1 and ImageCol2  from table SampleTab.

select 
      xp_write_file( 'C:\\temp\\imageCol1\\' || ID || '.jpg', imageCol1)
    , xp_write_file( 'C:\\temp\\imageCol2\\' || ID || '.jpg', imageCol2)
from SampleTab

entry.title: Adding revenue contract and performance obligation to Fiori AppDisplay Line Items in General Entries
entry.content:
Why Add These Fields?

When using CBRR, SAP automatically enriches journal entries with revenue contract and performance obligation IDs. The related postings, such as revenue recognition, revenue adjustment from invoice correction and balance sheet postings, are posted directly with the revenue contract and performance obligation IDs.  These identifiers are essential for:

  • Tracing postings back to revenue contracts
  • Supporting reconciliation and audit processes
  • Enabling detailed margin and revenue analysis
  • Improving user efficiency in daily operations

While Manage Journal Entries allows filtering by these fields, it does not provide the same line‚Äëitem list view that business users rely on. Adding the fields to the line‚Äëitem apps closes this gap.

What You Need Before You Start

This enhancement requires:

  • Access to the Custom Fields app (Extensibility role from the template role: SAP_BR_EXTENSIBLITY_SPEC)
  • No technical development or custom fields ‚Äî SAP delivers the fields already in ACDOCA

Time required: 20‚Äì30 minutes.

Step‚Äëby‚ÄëStep Guide: Adding the Fields

Step 1 ‚Äî Open the Custom Fields App

Navigate to: Extensibility ‚Üí Custom Fields

This app allows you to extend SAP‚Äëdelivered UIs with additional fields.

Step 2 ‚Äî Create a Data Source Extension

Go to the Data Source Extension tab, and Click Create

Select the data source extension FAC_GLV_GL_ACCOUNT_LINE_ITEMS_SRV ( Display Line Items in General Ledger )

Enter a description (SAP will propose an extension ID automatically).  Example: Revenue Contract

Click Create to continue

Step 3 ‚Äî Add the Required Fields

In the field selection screen,  click the Search icon.

Search for Revenue Accounting Contract.

Select the field and click Apply.

Repeat the process for Performance Obligation / Performance Application

These fields exist in the Universal Journal but are not part of the default field catalog ‚Äî which is why this extension is necessary.

Step 4 ‚Äî Publish the Extension

Accept the default labels,  Click Save & Publish.

SAP will now add these fields to the field catalog of the relevant apps.  Publishing may take a few minutes.

Step 5 ‚Äî Verify the Fields in the Apps

Open Display Line Items in General Ledger (and similarly Margin Analysis)

In the Filter Bar

Click Adapt Filters and confirm that you now see:

  • Revenue Accounting Contract
  • Performance Obligation

In the List View

Open Settings ‚Üí Adapt Columns and add:

  • Revenue Accounting Contract
  • Performance Obligation

These fields can now be used for filtering, sorting, and reporting.

Recommended Best Practice

In the Fiori App ‚ÄòDisplay Line Items in General Ledger‚Äô and ‚ÄòDisplay Line Items in Margin Analysis‚Äô,  you can create and save a custom view that includes these fields and share it with business users. This ensures consistent reporting across the project

Summary

Adding Revenue Contract and Performance Obligation IDs to the line‚Äëitem apps is:

  • Simple ‚Äî no coding required
  • SAP‚Äëstandard ‚Äî uses delivered extensibility
  • Valuable ‚Äî improves transparency and analysis
  • Fast ‚Äî completed in under 30 minutes

This enhancement is especially useful for organizations implementing Contract‚ÄëBased Revenue Recognition and wanting to streamline operational reporting.

entry.title: Re: Research: Unmanaged Transactional Buffer For RESTful Application Programming Model
entry.content:
What makes you consider choosing both the unmanaged scenario and implementing your own standalone transactional buffer in the first place?
If the legacy API has its own buffering mechanism then let's reuse that as a transactional buffer, right?
If there's no buffering then the API is not transactional and the unmanaged scenario doesn't make sense because there would be nothing to utilize in the CRUD methods. All your API calls can be made in determinations, validations, and ultimately in method save_modified just fine if you choose managed with unmanaged save.

entry.title: cds-toon-ai-protocol-adapter: a pragmatic way to cut AI token costs using SAP CAP
entry.content:
If you‚Äôve been experimenting with AI in enterprise apps, you‚Äôve probably felt the "token tax". It‚Äôs the silent cost hidden in every JSON payload you stream to an LLM. The more verbose the structure, the more you pay, both in latency and in cost.

This is exactly where the cds-toon-ai-protocol-adapter lands: a small, composable CAP plugin that brings the TOON (Token-Oriented Object Notation) protocol to your services. So you can keep your code, keep your patterns, and still send leaner payloads to AI systems.

In short:

  • It adds TOON as a protocol to CAP (REST and OData variants)
  • It automatically converts JSON ‚Üî TOON on the wire
  • It can auto-pick the most token-efficient response format
  • It logs token statistics so you can quantify the win

It's is directly inspired by an article I read on medium: "TOON, MCP and Agents: Less Hype, More Real Architecture (and a 25% Saving That Actually Matters)".

Toon procotol adapter in action

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why Toon in CAP?

Let‚Äôs start with the pain:

  • JSON is great for machines and tools, but it‚Äôs verbose for LLMs
  • LLM pricing and latency scale with tokens, not bytes
  • Sending full JSON schemas, deeply nested objects, and descriptive keys is comfortable for us, but expensive for models

TOON (Token-Oriented Object Notation) flips that mindset:

  • It‚Äôs a compact, human-readable, model-friendly representation
  • It removes structural noise while keeping semantic meaning
  • It often reduces token counts by 20‚Äì50% compared to JSON

What the adapter gives you in CAP:

  • A protocol-level optimization, no refactors in service logic
  • Opt-in per service via @protocol annotations
  • Automatic conversion on responses (JSON ‚Üí TOON), optional on requests (TOON ‚Üí JSON)
  • A safety net: it can auto-decide per response if JSON is actually cheaper and choose that instead

So the real "why" is simple: you can introduce AI cost and latency optimizations where they belong, at the boundary, without touching domain logic, entities, or your CAP service handlers.

Where it fits in your architecture

If your CAP service:

  • Feeds agents with app context
  • Exposes APIs to AI tools or MCP-style execution flows

‚Ä¶then the adapter sits right at the edge of your service. Clients can consume Toon endpoints or keep using JSON/OData, your service handlers continue to speak plain JavaScript objects. Meanwhile, the adapter keeps score and trims the fluff.

How to use it (in less than 5 minutes)

1) Install

npm install @geertjanklaps/cds-toon-ai-protocol-adapter

Make sure you‚Äôre on @sap/cds >= 9.

2) Annotate your service with the Toon protocol

REST-style TOON:

@protocol: ['toon']
service MyToonService {
}

Prefer OData compatibility but want TOON on the wire?

@protocol: ['toon-odata']
service MyToonService {
}

3) Implement your service as usual

NoTOON-specific code needed. No new SDK. Your handlers stay clean.

4) Configure behavior in package.json

{
  "cds": {
    "toonAdapter": {
      "requestProcessingEnabled": false,
      "responseProcessingEnabled": true,
      "logTokenStatistics": true,
      "autoDetermineResponseContentType": true
    }
  }
}

What this means:

  • responseProcessingEnabled: true ‚Üí your JSON responses can be converted to TOON
  • requestProcessingEnabled: false ‚Üí clients can still send JSON; turn this on if you want to accept TOON requests too
  • autoDetermineResponseContentType: true ‚Üí the adapter will send TOON or JSON based on which uses fewer tokens for that response
  • logTokenStatistics: true ‚Üí you‚Äôll see logs like: [toon] - Token count - JSON: 150, TOON: 95, Difference: 55 (36,7%)

5) Call the endpoints

  • REST base: /toon/
    • Example: GET /toon/my-toon-service/getData
  • OData base: /toon-odata/
    • Example: GET /toon-odata/my-toon-odata-service/getData

By default, clients can still send JSON. If you enable TOON requests, they can POST with Content-Type: text/toon.

When to use it

Ideal scenarios:

  • AI/LLM integrations where every token counts
  • Near-real-time experiences where shaving tokens reduces latency
  • Cost-sensitive workloads or multi-tenant setups where savings compound

Observed benefits:

  • Token reduction: typically 20‚Äì50% vs JSON
  • Lower bandwidth usage
  • Reduced AI API cost and faster roundtrips

This is not about "changing your data model for AI", it‚Äôs about optimizing the transport layer so your CAP services can collaborate with AI systems efficiently.

Practical tips:

  • Don‚Äôt refactor your code. Add the protocol, turn on responseProcessingEnabled, and measure
  • Keep autoDetermineResponseContentType enabled in production. Sometimes JSON is cheaper, let the adapter pick the winner
  • Enable logTokenStatistics in development and load tests. Record baseline token counts before/after
  • If you expose an MCP server using @gavdi/cap-mcp, use the toon-odata protocol

A minimal test you can run today

  1. Enable TOON on a read-heavy service
  2. Turn on logTokenStatistics
  3. Hit endpoints with realistic data (lists, expansions, nested structures)
  4. Compare JSON vs TOON token counts in logs
  5. Forward the same responses to your AI layer and measure end-to-end latency and cost

Expect measurable token drops on non-trivial payloads. In multi-tenant scenarios, those savings add up, quietly and meaningfully.

Closing thoughts

We don‚Äôt need more hype around "AI-native" architectures. We need small, composable decisions that make our systems cheaper, faster, and more maintainable. The cds-toon-ai-protocol-adapter does exactly that for CAP:

  • No rewrites.
  • Real savings.
  • Better UX for agents and LLMs.

If you‚Äôre serious about bringing AI into your SAP landscape, start where it hurts the budget: tokens on the wire. Add TOON at the protocol layer, measure, and move on to the next pragmatic win.

Useful links:

  • NPM: @geertjanklaps/cds-toon-ai-protocol-adapter
  • Issues and support: GitHub repository
  • Toon documentation: @toon-format/toon

If you try this in a multi-tenant setup or with MCP-heavy flows, I‚Äôd love to hear your numbers!

entry.title: Re: Query on Multiuser Login in the Custom MDK Client for...
entry.content: I am not sure there is a limit on how many users can share a device.  When a user switch occurs, the application is responsible for updating (removing / downloading) and user specific data as part of the OnUserSwitch event.  The MDK client does not maintain separate data stores for each user so as different users start using the device it does not result in a large change in storage.

entry.title: New Brazil NFe Integration with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, could edition
entry.content:
Electronic Invoices (aka NF-e ‚Äì Nota Fiscal) for Brazil with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition 

Background
In 2017, SAP introduced NF-e integration within SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (SAP‚Äôs strategic solution for electronic invoices and statutory reporting worldwide) through two dedicated cloud services: 

  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Outbound Invoicing Option for Brazil 
  • SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Inbound Invoicing Option for Brazil 

This era is now over: As part of its simplification strategy, SAP is now including the functionality in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, delivering a comprehensive global solution with optimised processes and metrics; without requiring separate onboarding or cloud services. SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition is SAP‚Äôs strategic, global service for e-invoicing and statutory reporting. Customers connect once and scale across countries and scenarios! It will cover Brazil NF-e in addition to more than 25 other countries (scenarios list). 

Join us for the webinar on February 26, 2026 to learn about the availability of Brazil NF-e through SAP Document and Reporting, cloud edition, its impact on existing customers, migration steps and effort as well as pre-requisites.  We are excited to meet you there!

entry.title: How to prevent IAS admins from being deleted during IPS Re-Sync after an instance refresh?
entry.content:
I will soon perform an Instance Refresh of our SAP SuccessFactors Dev environment.
After the refresh, I plan to run the IPS Re-Sync, as recommended by SAP.

The last time I did this (during a Preview refresh), I temporarily added a username filter in IPS so that no users were matched. This caused all existing users in IAS to be considered ‚Äúorphaned.‚Äù After removing the filter and running the Re-Sync again, many users were recreated successfully ‚Äî but most IAS administrators were deleted in the process.

My questions are:

  1. How can I avoid IAS administrators being deleted during an IPS Re-Sync after a refresh?
  2. Is it really necessary to delete existing IAS users before re-running the sync?
  3. If deletion is required, what additional steps can I take to ensure that IAS admins are not removed?

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: RAP EML to update Equipment Classification Characteristic value does not work
entry.content:
Dear all,

I have a SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud environment. In a ABAP Class method, I have following RAP EML code to update the characteristic value of a Technical object Equipment.

DATA: lt_update TYPE TABLE FOR UPDATE i_equipmentclfncharvaluetp.
SELECT SINGLE
    equipment,
    classtype,
    classinternalid,
    charcinternalid,
    clfncharcvaluepositionnumber
  FROM i_equipmentclfncharvaluetp
  WHERE equipment      = '000000000010000228'
    AND characteristic = 'PRODUCT_STATUS_NAME'
  INTO @DATA(ls_db).

lt_update = VALUE #(
  ( %tky-%key-equipment                      = ls_db-equipment
    %tky-%key-classtype                      = ls_db-classtype
    %tky-%key-classinternalid                = ls_db-classinternalid
    %tky-%key-charcinternalid                = ls_db-charcinternalid
    %tky-%key-clfncharcvaluepositionnumber   = ls_db-clfncharcvaluepositionnumber
    charcvalue = '02' 
    %control-charcvalue = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
  )
).

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_equipmenttp
  ENTITY equipmentclassfctncharcsvalue
  UPDATE FROM lt_update
  FAILED   DATA(lt_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(lt_reported).

COMMIT ENTITIES
  RESPONSE OF i_equipmenttp
  FAILED   DATA(lt_commit_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(lt_commit_reported).

The Equipment and Characteristic name as well as the value to be updated (CharcValue = '2' ) are all correct but still the code does not work. In the lt_commit_reported internal table, It keeps giving me error "No value was assigned to "Product Status"".

If I call an Equipment API with same details via POSTMAN , the update works as expected and no issues there.

Can someone help here and see what am i missing please?

Br

sapdevnl

entry.title: MCP Server for On Premise data
entry.content:
What is Model Context Protocol ?

MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an open-source standard for connecting AI applications to external systems.

An MCP server can provide access to  data sources, tools and apps within S4HANA which will enhance capabilities of an AI agent.

It allows an interface to  securely access tools, data and services.

For an ECC / S/4HANA system MCP can provide a solution to certain long-standing problems that customers have.

  • No access to ERP data for AI applications and agents.
  • Provide authorization control on tools and data that can be used.
  • A clean separation between AI application logic and ERP system.

Sample Architecture setup.

Step - by - step building an MCP server.

Let us consider the table SFLIGHT which holds flight connection data.

Create a CDS view and OData service that can expose SFLIGHT data as a REST API call.

Create and Activate the service

Sample entry through the created OData service for SFLIGHT data.

Create an MCP server to access OData service as an MCP tool.

Using FastMCP to create an MCP server that calls an OData service at the backend.

We need to next establish a connection between the on premise S/4HANA system and the MCP server on BTP.

We can accomplish this using the SAP Connectivity service and through cloud connector.

Cloud connector exposed back-end systems are now visible in the BTP cockpit for your account.

Deploy application on BTP.

MCP server is now running on BTP

Visualize the tools available and the MCP server through MCP Inspector.

Create a Basic ReACT agent and bind it with the MCP server.

Running the react agent with the query ‚ÄúCan you get plane type for carrier AA and connection 0017‚Äù

Flight information is correctly read and displayed.

entry.title: Changing the Default Row Limit in SAP Datasphere Data Preview
entry.content:

entry.title: Using Custom Logic in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to change field status of Purchase Requisition
entry.content:
Problem Background:

We received a customer request: when creating a purchase requisition, they want the Valuation Price field to be optional, but in the current system this field is mandatory.

Solution:

Attempt to meet the requirement through custom logic using a BAdI.

Analysis Steps:

1. After searching in SAP for Me, we found a KBA 3322867 - Valuation Price field is mandatory in Create Purchase Requisitions app - SAP for Me which provides a solution to this problem. So we can try to use BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PR_ FLDCNTRL_SIMPLE to solve this problem.

2. We enter APP Custom Logic to create an implementation. The description of this BAdI is "Change of Field Control for Purchase Requisitions". In the documentation, we can get more information including supported fields. "PURCHASEREQUISITIONPRICE - Valuation Price" is included, that means our requirement can be fulfilled by this BAdI.

3. With this BAdI, we can set four status for supported fields of Purchase Requisition: Hidden, Read-only, Mandatory, Optional.

  • '-': To hide the field
  • '*': To make the field read-only
  • '+': To make the field mandatory
  • '.': To make the field optional

4. The sample code of this BAdI is quite readable and easy. Based on this problem, implement the BAdI. The specific code is as follows.

FIELD-SYMBOLS <fs> TYPE mmpur_s_pr_fldsel.

READ TABLE fieldselection_table ASSIGNING <fs> WITH KEY field = 'PURCHASEREQUISITIONPRICE'.
IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
    <fs>-fieldstatus = '.'.
ENDIF.

5. After testing, the BAdI works prefect. This BAdI not only supports GUI APP - Create Purchase Requisition - Advanced, but also supports Fiori APP - Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional.

Conclusion:

By reading this article and several previous blogs on similar scenarios, I hope you now understand how to use custom logic to apply certain restrictions when creating preliminary invoices for purchase orders.
You can find more information about SAP S/4HANA Cloud procurement-related issues at the following link: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

You can also read more blogs about SAP S/4HANA Cloud procurement at the following link: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sourcing and Procurement - SAP Community

If you have any suggestions or thoughts about this article, please feel free to share them in the comments section. I look forward to communicating with you. You are also welcome to follow my personal account, and I look forward to seeing you in the next blog post!

entry.title: Why SAP RPT‚Äë1 Matters for Today‚Äôs and Future Generative AI in Predictive Business Insights?
entry.content:
Ever since the introduction of ChatGPT in November 2022, Generative AI has reshaped the AI industry. Companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and of course SAP have accelerated innovation, recognizing the enormous value Generative AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) bring to enterprise operations. 

General‚Äëpurpose LLMs excel at understanding language, reasoning over text, and identifying patterns in unstructured information. They are creative, adaptive, and capable of leveraging data from files, documents, and multimedia across diverse data systems.

The Motive

However, when it comes to actually predicting business outcomes, LLMs fall short. Why?
Because they are not designed for high‚Äëprecision, multi‚Äëstep reasoning over large, enterprise‚Äëgrade tabular datasets.

And this is where the majority of business data resides: structured tables, such as GL accounts, invoices, inventory, sales records, financial transactions, and countless others. Not in free‚Äëform text.

Everyone wants to be able to predict business outcomes like:

  • What is the probability of converting a sale?
  • Which customers are likely to pay late?
  • Who is at risk of churn?
  • ...
Historically, answering these questions required traditional machine learning like classification models, linear regression, etc. (a.k.a Traditional AI or Narrow AI). The problem with this is that classical ML requires to train a model per task, which easily can lead to hundreds of separate models hard to maintain in the long run, making it very cumbersome, expensive and extremely difficult to scale.
 
 
The Solution: SAP RPT-1
 
To solve this, SAP introduced in TechEd 2025 the first foundation model specifically designed for structured enterprise data: Relational Pre‚ÄëTrained Transformer 1 (RPT‚Äë1).  The model is trained natively on tabular business datasets and is engineered to understand rows, columns, joins and business semantics out of the box. As the name suggests, RPT‚Äë1 is:
  • Relational: optimized for structured relational business data
  • Pre‚Äëtrained: powered by tens of thousands of GPU hours (no more endless classical ML training cycles)
  • Transformer‚Äëbased: performs logical, not linguistic, transformations (e.g., filtering, joining, aggregating, and multi‚Äëstep reasoning)

Instead of hundreds of ML models, you now can use one single foundation model for many predictive tasks.

One of the most disruptive features of RPT‚Äë1 is its in‚Äëcontext learning capability. Instead of training or fine‚Äëtuning multiple modes, you simple provide historical rows of data and request predictions for new rows. Prediction cases like:

  • Customer churn prediction
  • Late delivery prediction
  • Late payment prediction
  • Sales conversion prediction
  • And many more

RPT‚Äë1 Performance Benchmark

RPT-1 outperforms both LLM and classical ML for tabular data and high value agentic cases. Here are some stats so far:

  • 50x faster than LLMs
  • Up to 2x Prediction Quality vs Narrow AI/ML Models
  • Up to 3.5x Prediction Quality vs LLMs
  • 100,000x fewer GPU FLOPs
  • 50,000x Less Energy consumption vs LLMs*

*comparable tasks on a NVIDIA H100, as a benchmark. Sources (TechEd, Blog) .

Why are these stats so important? On top of the benefits you can already imagine like time and resource savings; according to Gartner 40% of agentic-AI projects are likely to be canceled by end of 2027, mainly because of high cost, complexity, or unclear business value (source). RPT‚Äë1 directly addresses these challenges.

 

Sales Conversion Prediction Example Use Case

During SAP TechEd, a compelling demo showcased how RPT‚Äë1 integrates with SAP‚Äôs Agentic AI.

Imagine a sales team wanting to prioritize leads based on their likelihood to convert. Instead of manually training an ML model, a data analyst can use Joule to generate SQL code leveraging RPT‚Äë1‚Äôs PREDICT function.

Steps include:

  1. Join sales inquiries, historical performance, customer attributes, and other relevant data into a Data Product in SAP Business Data Cloud.
  2. Expose the Data Product to SAP HANA Cloud via zero‚Äëcopy.
  3. Use RPT‚Äë1 to instantly generate a new prediction column "sales_conversion_probability"; without training or tuning.

The model derives patterns directly from the historical data and produces high‚Äëquality prediction scores.

You can watch the full demo here (jump to minute 35:23).

 

Available RPT‚Äë1 Versions

SAP RPT‚Äë1 has been generally available since Q4 2025. You can choose from:

  • SAP RPT‚Äë1 Small: optimized for speed and efficiency
  • SAP RPT‚Äë1 Large: optimized for highest accuracy by using more capacity
  • SAP RPT‚Äë1 OSS (Open Source): available on HuggingFace and Github for exploration and learning

Try it yourself!

Don‚Äôt have access to a BTP account yet? here is an entry point:

  • Sign up for a 30-day SAP Generative AI Hub trial
  • Follow this step-by-step guide to get started by @sherene_tan 

 

Conclusion

SAP RPT‚Äë1 represents a major shift in how enterprises will deliver predictive insights in the GenAI era. While LLMs excel at language understanding, they are not built for structured, relational business data. RPT‚Äë1 closes this gap and eliminates the complexity of traditional machine learning, drastically reducing cost and compute.

With SAP RPT-1's foundation model purpose‚Äëbuilt for enterprise-grade tabular data, the objective is to enable organizations to operationalize predictive insights faster, more efficiently, and more accurately than ever before.

entry.title: Management of Mold Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

Our factory carries out mold manufacturing operations. For certain stages of the molds produced, subcontracting services are obtained from external companies. During the mold manufacturing process, various raw materials are combined and processed, resulting in the final product, the mold.

When we attempt to manage this process as an ongoing investment, we have identified that we are unable to track the inventory of our materials that are located at the subcontractor‚Äôs site. On the other hand, when we try to manage the process using a subcontracting routing, this approach does not yield healthy results for us due to the mold manufacturing lead time exceeding one month and the WIP process being closed.

We do not prefer to create separate material master records for each component, as we believe that generating an excessive number of material codes would unnecessarily complicate the system. Once the mold manufacturing is completed and the mold is received into inventory, it will be managed as a fixed asset.

Within this framework, we would highly appreciate your valuable opinions and recommendations on how this process can be correctly and traceably designed in SAP.
In your opinion, what would be the healthiest way to manage this process?

Kind regards,

entry.title: Access SAP S/4HANA Transaction Codes in SAP BTP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello Everybody,

 

Writing this blog to explain how we can access the SAP Transaction Codes of S/4HANA On Premise (SAP Rise) from SAP BTP Build Work Zone. SAP S/4HANA Rise system is a private cloud example, we can use public cloud also.

Here we are using SAP BTP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition. You can also use SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition also.

Prerequisites: Below are the prerequisites before we start:

-> Within the global account, you should subscribed to SAP Build Work Zone, standard edtion Service and Configured the Cloud Identity Service. The Work Zone will use Identity Authentication Service (IAS) to authenticate the Business Users.

-> In the Cloud Connector, configure the backend s/4hana system with https port for secure tunneled access and exchange the certifiate for Principal Propagation (The user of PP should be same in IAS and S4)

-> Destination should be there in the Sub account and choose the Principal Propagation as authentication.

 

Configuration:  There are 2 ways to configure the application, Page, spaces etc. in the build work zone:

1. Content Federation from S/4HANA system: In this we need to create the artifacts (Space, Pages, app etc.) in the S4 system and federate the content by making the content channel.

2. Local Artifcats in the Work Zone: Create Local Apps, Pages, spaces, groups etc. as required in the build work zone, standard edition.

 

We will be using the 2nd option as we are going to create local content in the work zone. Below are the configuration steps:

Step 1: Create App in the work zone

Access the Build Work Zone from the Sub account and got to Content Manager

Create a local app in the work zone, choose System (Destination) and form App UI Technology choose the SAP GUI for HTML

in this case, I have choosen the below transaction code, here we can put any transaction code as required

Step 2: Create page and assign app to page

Create a page and assign the appto page as below:

 

Step 3: Create Space and assign page to Space

 

Step 4: Create Role and assign app, space to role

 

Step 5:  Assign role to the site so it will be visible in site

Step 6: Assign role to user in Sub Account

Please note, Role created in the Work Zone will be shown as Role Collection in the Sub Account. So go to sub account and choose Role Collection and assign user to it.

 

Result: After Configuration all the above steps, when user will access the Work Zone then they can able to access the SAP S/4HANA transaction code as below:

 

I Hope this blog will help people to configure the SAP Transaction Code in Build Work Zone quickly without any issue.

 

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: Best Practice for Adjusting Project Progress Percentage in Review Customer Project
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition(fiori), and I need clarification on the standard process for adjusting project progress percentage when it doesn't match external tracking systems.

Current Situation:

  • External stakeholders track project progress separately, and their progress % often differs from SAP's calculated PoC

  • I need to increase or decrease progress percentage during the project lifecycle to align with external reporting

My Current Process:

  • During the project: I've been adjusting Plan values (increasing or decreasing planned costs) app to manipulate the progress percentage

  • At project end: I set ETC to 0 and run event-based revenue recognition to force 100% completion

  • I have NOT been setting forecast months regularly throughout the project

My Questions:

  1. Is adjusting Plan values the correct approach for mid-project progress reconciliation, or should I be using ETC adjustments instead?

  2. What is the SAP-recommended standard practice for ongoing progress alignment when external progress differs from system-calculated PoC?

  3. Should I be using forecast month settings systematically throughout the project lifecycle rather than only at project closure?

  4. What are the risks or downstream impacts of frequently modifying Plan values vs. ETC values?

  5. Are there official SAP guidelines or best practice documents for PoC adjustments in the Review Customer Project app?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Re: The consequences of implementing strictly Shift-left architectures
entry.content:
Thanks for taking up this difficult topic.

I see some large problems with the shift left approach so I fully agree that we will see a hybrid going forward.

The problems I see are

a) Back-end designers and developers don't understand what it data it takes to do analysis or even make AI on data

b) Back-end designers and developers are under pressure to deliver features and functionality not down-stream analytical useability

c) Not all can be standard and standards are not flexible.

ad a) The BW business content for ewm was a perfect example of back-end developers trying to deliver what they imagined was needed. The problem was that they did not understand the BW model leaving parts of the content pretty useless.

ad b) Most of us are measured on delivering results as fast as possible and that is not taking into account how much time is used down-stream by other teams.

ad c) In e.g. sales we we partner functions, some are standard like sold-to and ship-to but we have 3 custom partner functions that we can't run the business without. This will never come out of the box. Another example is classification data for materials. Using data products makes it worse as they are very inflexible of nature.

With kind regards

Kristian Appel

entry.title: Promotion Scenarios in SAP Customer Checkout (CCO)

Buy A, get B and C free
When a customer buys item A, items B and C should be added for free, and this should be clearly visible on the CCO sales screen.
Is this scenario possible to configure in CCO?

Discount as a ‚Äúfree amount‚Äù for other items

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP - IS - ( IA | CPI ) - The Commander's Blueprint: Rebuilding B2B EDI Governance with SAP
entry.content:
A long blog that could cover multiply topics. 

There is a number of decisions to take as a part of understanding your future EDI setup. 

Using the Standard TPM content is a good way to avoid the hey we just can just build it. It is a little as painful as building something in SAP PI where you where forced to use the framework. But here it makes a lot of sense to ensure you can build something that scales. 

Having a solid framework for governance around the TPM setup and roles is crucial. That include change history, transport and testing to understand what is going on. Here Figaf tool can help. 

There is a lot of strange rules inside your B2B Mappings because someone interpreted the business logic and someone else created the rules for it. Ideally we get out of this mess and get more clearly defined messages. But that would require a huge effort to find all the documents created. And MIG / MAG + a good sharepoint place to add all the documents too would make a huge difference.

entry.title: Re: The consequences of implementing strictly Shift-left architectures
entry.content:
Hello @Phil_from_Madrid 

to be honest... I read your blog twice, but still asking myself: "Where is the beef?"

I still don't understand your intention or your goal of this Blog?!

I've been a BW consultant for 20 years now, and I can fully agree with your BW part: Extractors, and especially BI Content have been the "data products" of today, for over 25 years, without any specific term. And I think even today, that content contained more than the current Data Products in SAP Datasphere... not only because there is none in SD or MM LoB, but also because there have been features and functionalities already 20 years ago, for which we have to fight via the influence portal, to get them again.

One example... and I'm sure, this will be one of the last things, around 2029 to be delivered, if at all: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/365526  

And one last thought... what bothers me from the beginning of the introduction of the term "data product" ... for me, a product is something that is basically finished, like goods you buy in a shop: Pants, Jacket, Refrigerator, TV, a car etc. it is like you bought it and does not change, unless you customize it by yourself.

For e.g. a final Forecast, Plan or Budget version, the term "data product" applies... it does not change anymore (usually). But for master data or actuals data, it changes every hour, every day... it is a temporary product only. Especially if a process changes, the same data exists as "old and new" data product, if e.g. more document types are contained in one year than the other (just an example).

I know, I will not be able to change this "logic", but I think it is still worth thinking about it. üòâ

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Not Found - GET http://nginx-redirector.repo-cache.sv...
entry.content:
Face the same issue here when npm install. Fixed it by following:

1. Remove package-lock.json

2. Execute command `npm set registry=https://registry.npmjs.org/`

3. `npm install`

In my case, package-lock.json was created in BAS. And when I tried to clone the repo and do npm install in my local machine, it occurs

npm error network request to http://nginx-redirector.repo-cache.svc.cluster.local/repository/appstudio-npm-group/@sap/ux-ui5-tooling/-/ux-ui5-tooling-1.6.7.tgz failed, reason: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND nginx-redirector.repo-cache.svc.cluster.local

I guess because the proxy got stored in package-lock.json, so remove package-lock.json shall be enough to solve the issue.

entry.title: Re: The consequences of implementing strictly Shift-left architectures
entry.content: @FernandoPerezMerino : Hi Fernando, of course I remember, ages ago, but good times. Thanks for taking the time to read and comment. The BDC object store is imho and in the theory the Silver layer, as it is positioned as the data distributing point, see Delta sharing. SAP calls the object that arrive there the "data products". Gold can combine these data sets and add "informational value" to these assests by deriving or combining them. That's what you call "secondary data products". These may be more specific for a given use case. SAP is offering their data products as is without the possiblity to intervene beforehand (apart of extensions). So they took the burden to make them good quality products that should be shared with other platforms further downstream. Kind regards, Philipp

entry.title: Re: IH01 ‚Äì Plant Field Is Prefilled by Default
entry.content:
Many fields are pre-filled using a parameter known as the SPA/GPA parameter. You can access this parameter by pressing F1 on the field to display technical information, where the parameter ID is listed as 'WRK' in your case?

The initial value for these fields is derived from the parameter value in transaction SU3. This value is then read and updated by various transactions using the parameter ID 'WRK,' which means the last used plant is set as the default.

Occasionally, the dynpro does not carry the parameter ID value, but the PBO/PAI modules use GET/SET PARAMETER ID statements to handle it.

Tips:

  • Transaction IH01 allows the creation of a user default variant. You can create one with the name 'U' + user_id, which might enable you to force the value of p_werk.
  • Alternatively, you can utilize existing BAdIs (Business Add-Ins) or implicit enhancement points to clear the parameter ID 'WRK.' For example, you can use BADI_EAM_STRUCTURE_LIST and test for a BAdI that executes early in the transaction.
